title: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description:
The current behavior in the XML Report Designer editor is causing inconvenience to users. When editing the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and then trying to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved. The message also prompts the user with options to save, discard, or cancel their changes. However, the wording of the message is unclear and the dialog is titled as "Error" (including the quotes).

A better and more typical approach would be to clearly state that the XML Report Design has been changed. Additionally, the dialog's title should be improved and should not contain any quotes.
OB: When editing the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed stating that the changes need to be saved. The error message is currently "Source page is dirty." However, it does not provide clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes.
EB: A better and more typical approach would be to provide a more descriptive error message such as "The XML Report Design has been modified". Additionally, the dialog should be titled appropriately without any quotes.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer.
2. Edit the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor.
3. Try to switch back to the Layout view.
4. Observe the error message displayed.
